greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Greatest common divisor of largest square dividing n and squarefree part of n.
comment: Record values occur at cubes of squarefree numbers: a(A062838(n))=A005117(n) and a(m) < A005117(n) for m < A062838(n). -  _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 09 2010
A220218(a(n)) = 1; A060476(a(n)) > 1 for n > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Nov 30 2015
link: R. Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Multiplicative with a(p^e)=1 for even e, a(p)=1, a(p^e)=p for odd e>1. - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 30 2002
a(n) = core(n)*rad(n/core(n))/rad(n), where core = A007913 and rad = A007947. - Conjecture by _Velin Yanev_, proof by _David J. Seal_, Sep 19 2017
mathematica: a[n_] := With[{sf = Times @@ Power @@@ ({#[[1]], Mod[#[[2]], 2]}& /@ FactorInteger[n])}, GCD[sf, n/sf]]; Table[a[n], {n, 1, 105}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Feb 05 2014 *)
program: a055229 n = product $ zipWith (^) ps (map (flip mod 2) es) where
results.author: _Labos Elemer_, Jun 21 2000
